faqs.question: How does the Resonite Conversion System work?
faqs.answer:
The Resonite conversion system prepares your avatar for the Resonite platform:

### Bone Name Conversion
- Automatically translates bone names to Resonite format
- Handles multiple naming conventions
- Adds necessary IK markers
- Preserves special bone functions

### Optimization Process
- Marks non-IK bones appropriately
- Maintains bone hierarchies
- Preserves weight assignments
- Handles twist bone configurations

### Special Handling
- Processes symmetrical bones
- Manages expression bones
- Handles physics bones
- Preserves animation data

[info]Bones marked with '<noik>' indicate they won't participate in IK calculations.[/info]

[note]This conversion ensures compatibility while maintaining avatar functionality.[/note]

faqs.question: How do the Bone Management Tools work?
faqs.answer:
The bone management tools provide comprehensive control over your avatar's skeleton:

### Digitigrade Setup
- Converts standard legs to digitigrade configuration
- Creates proper bone chains
- Maintains weight distributions
- Preserves IK functionality

### Weight Cleanup
- Removes zero-weight bones
- Cleans unused vertex groups
- Preserves important bones
- Maintains twist bone functionality

### Constraint Management
- Removes unnecessary constraints
- Cleans up bone relationships
- Optimizes IK chains
- Preserves essential constraints

[warning]Creating digitigrade legs will modify your avatar's bone structure. Make a backup before proceeding.[/warning]

[note]These tools help optimize your avatar's performance while maintaining functionality.[/note]

faqs.question: How do the Mesh Separation Tools work?
faqs.answer:
The mesh separation tools help organize and optimize your avatar's meshes:

### Material Separation
- Splits meshes by material assignments
- Preserves UV mappings
- Maintains vertex groups
- Keeps shape keys intact
- Optimizes material usage

### Loose Parts Separation
- Identifies disconnected mesh segments
- Creates individual mesh objects
- Preserves material assignments
- Maintains armature relationships
- Keeps vertex weights

[info]Separating meshes can help with organization and specific platform optimizations.[/info]

[note]Separated meshes maintain their original properties and can be rejoined later if needed.[/note]

faqs.question: How do the Bone Merging Tools work?
faqs.answer:
The bone merging tools offer various ways to combine and optimize bones:

### Merge to Active
- Combines selected bones into active bone
- Transfers vertex weights
- Updates bone constraints
- Preserves deformations
- Maintains shape keys

### Merge to Parent
- Merges bones with their parents
- Transfers child bone weights
- Updates bone hierarchies
- Preserves animations
- Maintains mesh deformations

### Connect Bones
- Links disconnected bones
- Fixes bone chains
- Maintains proper scaling
- Preserves bone roll
- Updates bone relationships

[warning]Bone merging operations are permanent and can affect animations. Always make a backup before proceeding.[/warning]

[note]These tools are useful for optimizing complex armatures while maintaining functionality.[/note]

faqs.question: How do the Additional Tools work?
faqs.answer:
The additional tools provide essential utilities for avatar optimization:

### Apply Transforms
- Applies all transformations to armature and meshes
- Resets transformation values
- Preserves visual appearance
- Updates mesh coordinates
- Maintains bone relationships

### Clean Shape Keys
- Removes unused shape keys
- Identifies duplicate shapes
- Preserves category markers
- Maintains blend shapes
- Optimizes memory usage

### Tolerance Control
- Customizable cleanup threshold
- Precise shape key comparison
- Prevents accidental removal
- Maintains subtle expressions

[info]Regular cleanup of shape keys can significantly improve avatar performance.[/info]

[note]These tools help maintain a clean and efficient avatar setup.[/note]
